label: 斐紙
説明文: Hishi, papers made from the fibers of W. retusa, a clove-like shrub, include torinoko-gami (鳥子紙), named for its eggshell-like color; atsuyō-gami (厚様紙), a heavier grade of torinoko-gami; and usuyō-gami (薄様紙), a thinner grade.#[article]Tomita Masahiro. The Classification and Evolution of Paper Used in Medieval Documents as Soon in Written Sources.
